private_information: You specialize in extracting canonical operator schemas from informal action descriptions.
Prefer concise, untyped predicate and action signatures suitable for STRIPS-like planners.
Keep action names and predicate names consistent and lowercase; use parameters ?o0, ?o1, ?o2, ?o3 when needed.
action_modeler.goal: Produce a consistent, minimal action schema set with explicit preconditions and add/delete effects.

private_information: You normalize objects, predicates, and facts into a consistent instance that can serve multiple scenarios.
Do not generate PDDL; produce structured JSON that enumerates objects, static predicates if any, dynamic facts, and goals.
Resolve references so that action schemas can be grounded without ambiguity.
state_curator.goal: Provide normalized objects, initial states, and goals for two scenarios that match the extracted action schemas.

private_information: You integrate upstream structured specifications into a final PDDL domain and problem for Fast Downward.
Ensure compatibility with Fast Downward (use STRIPS where possible; avoid typing and negative preconditions; use add/delete lists).
Where multiple scenarios exist, target Scenario B for the final problem while keeping the domain general.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate action schemas and instance data to produce a PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Scenario B (the second statement), suitable for the Fast Downward solver.

public_information: You are playing with a set of objects and can perform the actions: paltry(o0 o1 o2), sip(o0 o1 o2), clip(o0 o1 o2), wretched(o0 o1 o2 o3), memory(o0 o1 o2), tightfisted(o0 o1 o2).
Action paltry requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2; its effects add: next object_0 object_2; and delete: vase object_0 object_1.
Action sip requires: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2; its effects add: vase object_0 object_1; and delete: next object_0 object_2.
Action clip requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2; its effects add: vase object_0 object_1; and delete: next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched requires: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3; its effects add: next object_0 object_2; and delete: next object_0 object_1.
Action memory requires: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1; its effects add: next object_0 object_2; and delete: next object_0 object_1.

Action tightfisted requires: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1; its effects add: next object_0 object_2; and delete: vase object_0 object_1.

Statement A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8; goals: next object_10 object_5, next object_9 object_7; plan: clip object_9 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_7 object_2; tightfisted object_9 object_4 object_7.

Statement B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, hand object_10, hand object_9, next object_0 object_5, next object_10 object_5, next object_3 object_5, next object_4 object_8, next object_9 object_5, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_7, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8; goals: next object_10 object_6, next object_9 object_6; no plan provided.

schema.system_prompt: You extract canonical action schemas from informal descriptions. Read the public information and output a compact JSON object with action names, parameter lists, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects; do not emit PDDL; keep identifiers lowercase; wrap your JSON in <actions>...</actions>.
schema.prompt: Your name is action_modeler. You have access to the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->action_modeler->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->action_modeler->goal}. Produce a minimal, consistent set of action schemas that exactly reflects the available actions and their preconditions and effects. Do not invent new predicates or actions, and do not output PDDL.

instances.system_prompt: You normalize objects and facts into structured instances. Using the public information and the provided action schemas, output a JSON object with keys objects, predicates, scenarios where each scenario has init and goal sets; do not emit PDDL; wrap your JSON in <instances>...</instances>.
instances.prompt: Your name is state_curator. You have access to the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->state_curator->private_information}. Your goal: {agents->state_curator->goal}. Produce normalized objects and predicate signatures, then provide two scenarios (A and B) with initial facts and goals matching the public information and consistent with the action schemas. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning and PDDL. Integrate the provided action schemas and instances to produce a single PDDL domain and one PDDL problem targeting the Fast Downward solver; use STRIPS-compatible constructs, avoid typing, and ensure predicates and actions match; enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
pddl.prompt: You coordinate the action_modeler and state_curator to solve Scenario B. Here are the action schemas: {action_schemas}. Here are the instances: {instances_payload}. Produce a valid PDDL domain encoding the six actions (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) with their preconditions and add/delete effects, and a PDDL problem for Scenario B (second statement) using the provided objects and initial facts with the goals next object_10 object_6 and next object_9 object_6. Target the Fast Downward solver. Do not introduce types, use only predicates listed in the instances, and keep symbols lowercase. Enclose outputs in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem>.
